com.amazon.device.ads

Class InterstitialAd

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.amazon.device.ads.InterstitialAd
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Ad

    public class InterstitialAd
extends java.lang.Object
implements Ad
    A full screen interstitial ad. It will display over top of the application and have its own close button for the user to dismiss it. Only one InterstitiaAd may be shown at a time, but any number of instances can be created and loaded.

    Making ad requests to the Amazon Mobile Ad Network requires the INTERNET permission. Additionally we recommend that you include permissions for FINE_LOCATION, COURSE_LOCATION, NETWORK_STATE, and WIFI_STATE. These additional permissions allow Amazon to provide contextual and geo-targeted ads to your users, which may result in higher CPMs. Declare these permissions in your AndroidManifest.xml.

    • Method Detail

      • setListener

        public void setListener(AdListener adListener)
        Sets the listener used to track ad life-cycle events. Only one listener can be assigned per Ad instance. Calling setListener a second time would overwrite the existing listener with the new listener.
        Specified by:
        setListener in interface Ad

      • loadAd

        public boolean loadAd()
        Load a single ad into this InterstitialAd, with no targeting options Creates a background thread to load a new ad.
        Specified by:
        loadAd in interface Ad
        Returns:
        Returns true if a background thread is created to load a new ad, and returns false if the load ad request is ignored because there is currently a background thread in progress or because the current ad is expanded.
        See Also:
        com.amazon.device.ads.Ad#loadAd(AdTargetingOptions)}

      • loadAd

        public boolean loadAd(AdTargetingOptions options)
        Load a single ad into this InterstitialAd Creates a background thread to load a new ad based on AdTargetingOptions. When the ad loads successfully AdListener.onAdLoaded(Ad, AdProperties) is called. When the ad fails to load the AdListener.onAdFailedToLoad(Ad, AdError) is called. An ad that is currently loaded will only be cleared if the new Ad.loadAd(AdTargetingOptions) call completes successfully.

        Only one ad can be loading at a time. The Ad.loadAd(AdTargetingOptions) call will return true if a background thread is created to load a new ad, and false if the load ad request is ignored because there is currently a background thread in progress.

        Making ad requests to the Amazon Mobile Ad Network requires the INTERNET permission. Additionally we recommend that you include permissions for FINE_LOCATION, COURSE_LOCATION, NETWORK_STATE, and WIFI_STATE. These additional permissions allow Amazon to provide contextual and geo-targeted ads to your users, which may result in higher CPMs. Declare these permissions in your AndroidManifest.xml.
        Specified by:
        loadAd in interface Ad
        Parameters:
        options - Additional ad options. Use this parameter to set targeting settings
        Returns:
        Returns true if a background thread is created to load a new ad, and returns false if the load ad request is ignored because there is currently a background thread in progress or because the current ad is expanded.

      • isAdShowing

        public static boolean isAdShowing()
        Checks if an InterstitialAd is currently showing to the user. This is true if any InterstitialAd object will return a value of true from its isShowing() method.
        Returns:
        true if an InterstitialAd is currently showing

      • isLoading

        public boolean isLoading()
        Gets whether this Ad is currently being loaded. Only one ad can be loading at a time. Use this method to check if a new Ad.loadAd(AdTargetingOptions) call can be made.
        Specified by:
        isLoading in interface Ad
        Returns:
        Returns true if an ad is currently being loaded, and false if there is no ad being loaded.

      • isShowing

        public boolean isShowing()
        Tells whether this InterstitialAd is currently being displayed to the user
        Returns:
        true if this InterstitialAd is currently being displayed to the user

      • isReady

        public boolean isReady()
        Tells whether this InterstitialAd is ready to show. This ad will be ready to show if it has been successfully loaded and it has not expired
        Returns:
        true if this InterstitialAd is ready to show

      • showAd

        public boolean showAd()
        Shows the Ad to the user, if it is ready to show.
        Returns:
        true if the ad is shown to the user

      • getTimeout

        public int getTimeout()
        Gets the current timeout value in milliseconds.
        Specified by:
        getTimeout in interface Ad
        Returns:
        The current timeout value in milliseconds.

      • setTimeout

        public void setTimeout(int timeout)
        Sets the timeout value for loading the ad. Loading starts when Ad.loadAd(AdTargetingOptions) is called. The default value is 20000 milliseconds.
        Specified by:
        setTimeout in interface Ad
        Parameters:
        timeout - The timeout in milliseconds.
